questions.text: Question 1: What is the time complexity of binary search? Explain your reasoning.
questions.answer_key: The time complexity of binary search is O(log n). In each iteration, binary search divides the search space in half, leading to a logarithmic number of comparisons in the worst case.

rubric.instructions: Check if student provided O(log n) and explained the halving of search space.

questions.text: Question 2: Write pseudocode for implementing a stack using two queues.

rubric.instructions: Evaluate the correctness of push and pop operations, and clarity of pseudocode.

questions.text: Question 3: Explain the difference between depth-first search (DFS) and breadth-first search (BFS). When would you use each?

rubric.instructions: Check understanding of both algorithms and appropriate use cases.

general_rubric.instructions: Grade based on correctness, completeness, and clarity. Award partial credit for partial understanding.

grading_instructions: Evaluate each answer for correctness and completeness. Provide constructive feedback. Be consistent across all submissions.
